channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Daniel Ek says Spotify has ‘never been in a stronger position’ as music streamer caps remarkable 2024 turnaround
item.description: The streaming giant beat expectations across several metrics as it approaches its first ever full year of profitability.

item.title: U.S. jury awards $42 million to 3 former Abu Ghraib detainees, holding Virginia military contractor responsible
item.description: A different jury earlier this year couldn't agree on whether Reston, Va.-based CACI should be held liable for its civilian interrogators who worked al...

item.title: Take the ‘Death Stairs’ if You Dare
item.description: A Facebook page, which began among a few friends, has grown into a popular photo collection of hazardous stairs.

item.title: Aid Deliveries to Gaza Remain Low Despite U.S. Warning to Israel
item.description: The Biden administration gave Israel 30 days to increase the flow of aid, warning that aid shipments into Gaza in September had reached an alarmingly ...

item.title: U.K. Plans to Fine Tech Executives for Illegal Weapon Sales Online
item.description: In a bid to curb knife crime, the government would hold officials of tech companies personally liable for illicit sales on their platforms, a signific...

item.title: After calling Germany’s chancellor a ‘fool’, Elon Musk now wants Italy’s judges to be removed
item.description: The billionaire's comments were labelled as "unacceptable interference" in Italian affairs by Italy's centre-left Democratic Party.

item.title: 2024 Fossil Fuel Emissions Are Headed for a Record
item.description: Countries promised to move away from coal, oil and natural gas at last year’s climate summit. New research shows they’re burning more than ever before...

item.title: Amtrak Says Service Between New York and New Haven Will Return in Afternoon
item.description: The train service suspension, caused by a fire in the Bronx, was expected to disrupt the Wednesday morning commute in the New York City area.

item.title: Founding family of 7-Eleven’s Japanese owner has made a bid to take it private and head off takeover by Canadian rival Alimentation Couche-Tard
item.description: With around 85,000 outlets, 7-Eleven is the world's biggest convenience chain.

item.title: Archbishop of Canterbury Resigns Over U.K. Church Abuse Scandal
item.description: Justin Welby, the leader of 85 million Anglicans worldwide, announced his resignation days after a report found he had taken insufficient action over ...

item.title: AT&T CEO calls for freeing up 5G spectrum, or else America risks falling behind
item.description: AT&T CEO John Stankey makes a compelling case to give the private sector access to more precious spectrum for 5G.

item.title: Trump’s Department for ‘Drastic Change,’ and the Race for Senate Leadership
item.description: Plus, the streaming services you never knew about.

item.title: A Man Was Missing for Months. Investigators Say He Faked His Death.
item.description: The authorities spent weeks searching a Wisconsin lake for the man’s body before discovering that he had moved money into a foreign bank account and h...

item.title: Republicans and Democrats Highly Divided in Economic Outlook Under Trump
item.description: Consumer sentiment among Republicans has soared to its highest point since Donald J. Trump left the White House, while declining among Democrats.
